title.value: Modeling Eye Gaze to Videos Using Dynamic Trajectory Variability Analysis
title.justification: The section titled '156. Modeling Eye Gaze to Videos Using Dynamic Trajectory Variability Analysis' discusses a study involving deep learning models and methods.
title.quote: 156. Modeling Eye Gaze to Videos Using Dynamic Trajectory Variability Analysis

extractions.description: This study uses dynamic trajectory variability analysis and ridge regressions to model eye gaze patterns in videos, especially focusing on differences between autistic and control participants.

type.justification: The paper describes a study where empirical methods are used to collect and analyze data on eye gaze patterns.
type.quote: Methods: 20 control (CTL) (3 females, age 1⁄4 32.2 ± 5.5) and 10 autistic (ASD) participants (2 females, age 1⁄4 29.8 ± 5.4) watched 18 short videos.

name.justification: The focus on analyzing eye gaze patterns in video is a typical application of computer vision.
name.quote: Background: Individuals with autism have atypical gaze onto the features of naturalistic movies, but a quantitative account has been elusive

name.justification: The study specifically implements eye-tracking to understand gaze patterns, indicating this as a subfield of the research.
name.quote: Keywords: Eye Tracking, Naturalistic, Attention, Autism

name.justification: The study implements a modeling technique called Dynamic Trajectory Variability Analysis to analyze eye-tracking data.
name.quote: Dynamic trajectory variability anal- ysis was used to construct trajectory dissimilarity matrices (TDM) from the eyetracking data.

is_contributed.justification: The paper indicates a focus on this methodology, suggesting it may be unique to their research.
is_contributed.quote: Dynamic trajectory variability anal- ysis was used...

is_executed.justification: The method described is used within the study to process data.
is_executed.quote: Dynamic trajectory variability anal- ysis was used to construct trajectory dissimilarity matrices (TDM) from the eyetracking data.

is_compared.justification: There is no explicit comparison between this model and others.
is_compared.quote: Our analysis produced a multivariate “finger- print” quantifying how video features affect gaze heterogeneity...

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper for the model's origin; it seems to be developed within the paper's context.
